name: wavefront
description: A Pulumi package for creating and managing wavefront cloud resources.
attribution: This Pulumi package is based on the [`wavefront` Terraform Provider](https://github.com/vmware/terraform-provider-wavefront).

method.description: The notification method used for notification target. One of `WEBHOOK`, `EMAIL`, `PAGERDUTY`.

appName.description: The name of a NewRelic App

metricFilterRegex.description: A regular expression that a metric name must match (case-insensitively) in order to be ingested

defaultValue.description: The default value of the parameter

dynamicFieldType.description:
For `DYNAMIC` parameter types, the type of the field. Valid options are `SOURCE`,
`SOURCE_TAG`, `METRIC_NAME`, `TAG_KEY`, `MATCHING_SOURCE_TAG`

hideFromView.description: If `true` the parameter will only be shown on the edit view of the dashboard

name.description: The name of the parameters

parameterType.description: The type of the parameter. `SIMPLE`, `LIST`, or `DYNAMIC`

queryValue.description: For `DYNAMIC` parameter types, the query to execute to return values

tagKey.description: for `TAG_KEY` dynamic field types, the tag key to return

valuesToReadableStrings.description:
A string->string map.  At least one of the keys must match the value of
`default_value`

name.description: Name of this section

charts.description: Charts in this section. See dashboard chart

base.description: The base of logarithmic scale charts. Omit or set to 0 for the default linear scale. Usually set to 10 for the traditional logarithmic scale.

name.description: Name of the source

sources.description: Query expression to plot on the chart. See chart source queries

summarization.description:
Summarization strategy for the chart. MEAN is default. Valid options are, `MEAN`, 
`MEDIAN`, `MIN`, `MAX`, `SUM`, `COUNT`, `LAST`, `FIRST`

units.description: String to label the units of the chart on the Y-Axis

customTags.description: For the tabular view, a list of point tags to display when using the `custom` tag display mode

expectedDataSpacing.description:
Threshold (in seconds) for time delta between consecutive points in a series
above which a dotted line will replace a solid in in line plots. Default 60

fixedLegendDisplayStats.description: For a chart with a fixed legend, a list of statistics to display in the legend

fixedLegendEnabled.description: Whether to enable a fixed tabular legend adjacent to the chart

fixedLegendFilterField.description:
Statistic to use for determining whether a series is displayed on the fixed legend.
Valid options are `CURRENT`, `MEAN`, `MEDIAN`, `SUM`, `MIN`, `MAX`, `COUNT`

fixedLegendFilterLimit.description: Number of series to include in the fixed legend

fixedLegendFilterSort.description:
Whether to display `TOP` or `BOTTOM` ranked series in a fixed legend. Valid options
are `TOP`, and `BOTTOM`

fixedLegendPosition.description:
Where the fixed legend should be displayed with respect ot the chart.
Valid options are `RIGHt`, `TOP`, `LEFT`, `BOTTOM`

fixedLegendUseRawStats.description: If `true`, the legend uses non-summarized stats instead of summarized

groupBySource.description:
For the tabular view, whether to group multi metrics into a single row by a common source.
If `false`, each source is displayed in its own row.  if `true`, multiple metrics for the same host will be displayed as different
columns in the same row

invertDynamicLegendHoverControl.description:
Whether to disable the display of the floating legend (but
reenable it when the ctrl-key is pressed)

lineType.description:
Plot interpolation type.  `linear` is default. Valid options are `linear`, `step-before`, 
`step-after`, `basis`, `cardinal`, `monotone`

max.description: Max value of the Y-axis. Set to null or leave blank for auto

min.description: Min value of the Y-axis. Set to null or leave blank for auto

numTags.description: For the tabular view, how many point tags to display

plainMarkdownContent.description: The markdown content for a Markdown display, in plain text.

showHosts.description: For the tabular view, whether to display sources. Default is `true`

showLabels.description: For the tabular view, whether to display labels. Default is `true`

showRawValues.description: For the tabular view, whether to display raw values. Default is `false`

sortValuesDescending.description: For the tabular view, whether to display display values in descending order. Default is `false`

sparklineDecimalPrecision.description: For the single stat view, the decimal precision of the displayed number

sparklineDisplayColor.description:
For the single stat view, the color of the displayed text (when not dynamically determined). 
Values should be in `rgba(,,,,)` format

sparklineDisplayFontSize.description: For the single stat view, the font size of the displayed text, in percent

sparklineDisplayHorizontalPosition.description:
For the single stat view, the horizontal position of the displayed text.
Valid options are `MIDDLE`, `LEFT`, `RIGHT`

sparklineDisplayPostfix.description: For the single stat view, a string to append to the displayed text

sparklineDisplayPrefix.description: For the single stat view, a string to add before the displayed text

sparklineDisplayValueType.description:
For the single stat view, where to display the name of the query or the value of the query.
Valid options are `VALUE` or `LABEL`

sparklineFillColor.description:
For the single stat view, the color of the background fill.  Values should be
in `rgba(,,,,)`

sparklineLineColor.description: For the single stat view, the color of the line.  Values should be in `rgba(,,,,)` format

sparklineSize.description:
For the single stat view, This determines whether the sparkline of the statistic is displayed in the chart `BACKGROUND`, `BOTTOM`, or `NONE`.
Valid options are `BACKGROUND`, `BOTTOM`, `NONE`

sparklineValueColorMapApplyTo.description:
For the single stat view, whether to apply dyunamic color settings to 
the displayed `TEXT` or `BACKGROUND`. Valid options are `TEXT` or `BACKGROUND`

sparklineValueColorMapColors.description:
For the single stat view, A list of colors that differing query values map to. 
Must contain one more element than `sparkline_value_color_map_values_v2`. Values should be in `rgba(,,,,)`

sparklineValueColorMapValuesV2s.description:
For the single stat view, a list of boundaries for mapping different
query values to colors.  Must contain one less element than `sparkline_value_color_map_colors`

sparklineValueTextMapTexts.description:
For the single stat view, a list of display text values that different query
values map to.  Must contain one more element than `sparkline_value_text_map_thresholds`

sparklineValueTextMapThresholds.description:
For the single stat view, a list of threshold boundaries for 
mapping different query values to display text.  Must contain one less element than `sparkline_value_text_map_text`

stackType.description:
Type of stacked chart (applicable only if chart type is `stacked`). `zero` (default) means
stacked from y=0. `expand` means normalized from 0 to 1.  `wiggle` means minimize weighted changes. `silhouette` means to
center the stream. Valid options are `zero`, `expand`, `wiggle`, `silhouette`, `bars`

tagMode.description:
For the tabular view, which mode to use to determine which point tags to display.
Valid options are `all`, `top`, or `custom`

timeBasedColoring.description: For x-y scatterplots, whether to color more recent points as darker than older points

type.description:
Chart Type. `line` refers to the Line Plot, `scatter` to the Point Plot, `stacked-area` to 
the Stacked Area plot, `table` to the Tabular View, `scatterploy-xy` to Scatter Plot, `markdown-widget` to the
Markdown display, and `sparkline` to the Single Stat view. Valid options areÂ `line`, `scatterplot`,
`stacked-area`, `stacked-column`, `table`, `scatterplot-xy`, `markdown-widget`, `sparkline`, `globe`, `nodemap`,
`top-k`, `status-list`, `histogram`

windowSize.description: Width, in minutes, of the time window to use for `last` windowing

windowing.description:
For the tabular view, whether to use the full time window for the query or the last X minutes.
Valid options are `full` or `last`

xmax.description: For x-y scatterplots, max value for the X-axis. Set to null for auto

xmin.description: For x-y scatterplots, min value for the X-axis. Set to null for auto

y0ScaleSiBy1024.description: Whether to scale numerical magnitude labels for left Y-axis by 1024 in the IEC/Binary manner (instead of by 1000 like SI)

y0UnitAutoscaling.description: Whether to automatically adjust magnitude labels and units for the left Y-axis to favor smaller magnitudes and larger units

y1ScaleSiBy1024.description: Whether to scale numerical magnitude labels for right Y-axis by 1024 in the IEC/Binary manner (instead of by 1000 like SI)

y1UnitAutoscaling.description: Whether to automatically adjust magnitude labels and units for the right Y-axis to favor smaller magnitudes and larger units

y1Units.description: For plots with multiple Y-axes, units for right side Y-axis

y1max.description: For plots with multiple Y-axes, max value for the right side Y-axis. Set null for auto

y1min.description: For plots with multiple Y-axes, min value for the right side Y-axis. Set null for auto

ymax.description: For x-y scatterplots, max value for the Y-axis. Set to null for auto

ymin.description: For x-y scatterplots, min value for the Y-axis. Set to null for auto

name.description: Name of the source

query.description: Query expression to plot on the chart

queryBuilderEnabled.description: Whether oir not this source line should have the query builder enabled

scatterPlotSource.description: For scatter plots, does this query source the X-axis or the Y-axis, `X`, or `Y`.

sourceDescription.description: A description for the purpose of this source

provider.description:
The provider type for the wavefront package. By default, resources use package-wide configuration
settings, however an explicit `Provider` instance may be created and passed during resource
construction to achieve fine-grained programmatic control over provider settings. See the
[documentation](https://www.pulumi.com/docs/reference/programming-model/#providers) for more information.

additionalInformation.description:
User-supplied additional explanatory information for this alert.
Useful for linking runbooks, migrations...etc

alertType.description:
The type of alert in Wavefront.  Either `CLASSIC` (default) 
or `THRESHOLD`

canModifies.description: A list of users or groups that can modify this resource.

canViews.description: A list of users or groups that can view this resource.

condition.description:
A Wavefront query that is evaluated at regular intervals (default 1m).
The alert fires and notifications are triggered when data series matching this query evaluates
to a non-zero value for a set number of consecutive minutes.

conditions.description:
a string->string map of `severity` to `condition` 
for which this alert will trigger.

displayExpression.description:
A second query whose results are displayed in the alert user
interface instead of the condition query.  This field is often used to display a version
of the condition query with Boolean operators removed so that numerical values are plotted.

minutes.description:
The number of consecutive minutes that a series matching the condition query must 
evaluate to "true" (non-zero value) before the alert fires.

name.description: The name of the alert as it is displayed in Wavefront.

notificationResendFrequencyMinutes.description:
How often to re-trigger a continually failing alert. 
If absent or <= 0, no re-triggering occur.

resolveAfterMinutes.description:
The number of consecutive minutes that a firing series matching the condition
query must evaluate to "false" (zero value) before the alert resolves.  When unset, this default sto
the same value as `minutes`.

severity.description: - Severity of the alert, valid values are `INFO`, `SMOKE`, `WARN`, `SEVERE`.

tags.description: A set of tags to assign to this resource.

target.description:
A comma-separated list of the email address or integration endpoint 
(such as PagerDuty or web hook) to notify when the alert status changes.

additionalInformation.description:
User-supplied additional explanatory information for this alert.
Useful for linking runbooks, migrations...etc

alertType.description:
The type of alert in Wavefront.  Either `CLASSIC` (default) 
or `THRESHOLD`

canModifies.description: A list of users or groups that can modify this resource.

canViews.description: A list of users or groups that can view this resource.

minutes.description:

name.description: The name of the alert as it is displayed in Wavefront.

notificationResendFrequencyMinutes.description:

If absent or <= 0, no re-triggering occur.

resolveAfterMinutes.description:

query must evaluate to "false" (zero value) before the alert resolves.  When unset, this default sto
the same value as `minutes`.

severity.description: - Severity of the alert, valid values are `INFO`, `SMOKE`, `WARN`, `SEVERE`.

tags.description: A set of tags to assign to this resource.

target.description:
A comma-separated list of the email address or integration endpoint 
(such as PagerDuty or web hook) to notify when the alert status changes.

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering Alert resources.

additionalInformation.description:
User-supplied additional explanatory information for this alert.
Useful for linking runbooks, migrations...etc

alertType.description:
The type of alert in Wavefront.  Either `CLASSIC` (default) 
or `THRESHOLD`

canModifies.description: A list of users or groups that can modify this resource.

canViews.description: A list of users or groups that can view this resource.

A Wavefront query that is evaluated at regular intervals (default 1m).
The alert fires and notifications are triggered when data series matching this query evaluates
to a non-zero value for a set number of consecutive minutes.

conditions.description:
a string->string map of `severity` to `condition` 
for which this alert will trigger.

interface instead of the condition query.  This field is often used to display a version

the same value as `minutes`.

severity.description: - Severity of the alert, valid values are `INFO`, `SMOKE`, `WARN`, `SEVERE`.

tags.description: A set of tags to assign to this resource.

target.description:
A comma-separated list of the email address or integration endpoint 
(such as PagerDuty or web hook) to notify when the alert status changes.

contentType.description: The value of the `Content-Type` header of the webhook.

customHeaders.description:
A `string->string` map specifying the custome HTTP header key/value pairs that will be 
sent in the requests with a method of `WEBHOOK`.

emailSubject.description: The subject title of an email notification target.

isHtmlContent.description: Determine whether the email alert content is sent as HTML or text.

method.description: The notification method used for notification target. One of `WEBHOOK`, `EMAIL`, `PAGERDUTY`.

name.description: The name of the alert target as it is displayed in wavefront

recipient.description:
The end point for the notification Target.  `EMAIL`: email address. `PAGERDUTY`: PagerDuty 
routing key. `WEBHOOK`: URL endpoint.

routes.description: List of routing targets that this alert target will notify. See Route

template.description: A mustache template that will form the body of the POST request, email and summary of the PagerDuty.

triggers.description:
A list of occurrences on which this webhook will be fired. Valid values are `ALERT_OPENED`,
`ALERT_UPDATED`, `ALERT_RESOLVED`, `ALERT_MAINTENANCE`, `ALERT_SNOOZED`, `ALERT_NO_DATA`, `ALERT_NO_DATA_RESOLVED`, `ALERT_NO_DATA_MAINTENANCE`.

contentType.description: The value of the `Content-Type` header of the webhook.

customHeaders.description:
A `string->string` map specifying the custome HTTP header key/value pairs that will be 
sent in the requests with a method of `WEBHOOK`.

emailSubject.description: The subject title of an email notification target.

isHtmlContent.description: Determine whether the email alert content is sent as HTML or text.

method.description: The notification method used for notification target. One of `WEBHOOK`, `EMAIL`, `PAGERDUTY`.

name.description: The name of the alert target as it is displayed in wavefront

recipient.description:
The end point for the notification Target.  `EMAIL`: email address. `PAGERDUTY`: PagerDuty 
routing key. `WEBHOOK`: URL endpoint.

routes.description: List of routing targets that this alert target will notify. See Route

template.description: A mustache template that will form the body of the POST request, email and summary of the PagerDuty.

triggers.description:
A list of occurrences on which this webhook will be fired. Valid values are `ALERT_OPENED`,
`ALERT_UPDATED`, `ALERT_RESOLVED`, `ALERT_MAINTENANCE`, `ALERT_SNOOZED`, `ALERT_NO_DATA`, `ALERT_NO_DATA_RESOLVED`, `ALERT_NO_DATA_MAINTENANCE`.

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering AlertTarget resources.

contentType.description: The value of the `Content-Type` header of the webhook.

customHeaders.description:
A `string->string` map specifying the custome HTTP header key/value pairs that will be 
sent in the requests with a method of `WEBHOOK`.

routing key. `WEBHOOK`: URL endpoint.

A list of occurrences on which this webhook will be fired. Valid values are `ALERT_OPENED`,

additionalTags.description: A list of point tag key-values to add to every point ingested using this integration

appFilterRegexes.description:
List of regular expressions that a application name must match (case-insensitively) 
in order to be ingested

enableAppInfraMetrics.description: Boolean flag to control Application Infrastructure metric injection

enableBackendMetrics.description: Boolean flag to control Backend metric injection

enableBusinessTrxMetrics.description: Boolean flag to control Business Transaction metric injection

enableErrorMetrics.description: Boolean flag to control Error metric injection

enableIndividualNodeMetrics.description: Boolean flag to control Individual Node metric injection

enableOverallPerfMetrics.description: Boolean flag to control Overall Performance metric injection

enableRollup.description:
Set this to `false` to get separate results for all values within the time range, 
by default it is `true`

enableServiceEndpointMetrics.description: Boolean flag to control Service End point metric injection

forceSave.description: Forces this resource to save, even if errors are present

service.description: A value denoting which cloud service this service integrates with

serviceRefreshRateInMinutes.description: How often, in minutes, to refresh the service

userName.description: Username is a combination of userName and the account name

A string->string map whitelist of instance tag-value pairs (in AWS).

Multiple entries are OR'ed

categories.description:
A list of Google Cloud Platform (GCP) services.  Valid values are `APPENGINE`, 
`BIGQUERY`, `BIGTABLE`, `CLOUDFUNCTIONS`, `CLOUDIOT`, `CLOUDSQL`, `CLOUDTASKS`, `COMPUTE`, `CONTAINER`,
`DATAFLOW`, `DATAPROC`, `DATASTORE`, `FIREBASEDATABASE`, `FIREBASEHOSTING`, `FIRESTORE`, `INTERCONNECT`,
`LOADBALANCING`, `LOGGING`, `ML`, `MONITORING`, `PUBSUB`, `REDIS`, `ROUTER`, `SERVICERUNTIME`, `SPANNER`, `STORAGE`,
`TPU`, `VPN`

jsonKey.description:
Private key for a Google Cloud Platform (GCP) service account within your project.
The account must be at least granted Monitoring Viewer permissions. This key must be in the JSON format generated by GCP.

canModifies.description: A list of users that have modify ACL access to the dashboard

canViews.description: A list of users that have view ACL access to the dashboard

displayQueryParameters.description:
Whether the dashboard parameters section is opened by default when the dashboard
is shown

displaySectionTableOfContents.description:
Whether the "pills" quick-linked the sections of the dashboard are 
displayed by default when the dashboard is shown

eventFilterType.description:
How charts belonging to this dashboard should display events. BYCHART is default if 
unspecified; Valid options are: `BYCHART`, `AUTOMATIC`, `ALL`, `NONE`, `BYDASHBOARD`, and `BYCHARTANDDASHBOARD`

parameterDetails.description: The current JSON representation of dashboard parameters. See parameter details

isLogIntegration.description: Whether this is a "Log Integration" subType of external link

metricFilterRegex.description: Controls whether a link is displayed in the context menu of a highlighted series. If present, the metric name of the highlighted series must match this regular expression in order for the link to be displayed.

name.description: The name of the external link

pointTagFilterRegexes.description: Controls whether a link is displayed in the context menu of a highlighted series. This is a map from string to regular expression. The highlighted series must contain point tags whose keys are present in the keys of this map and whose values match the regular expressions associated with those keys in order for the link to be displayed

sourceFilterRegex.description: Controls whether a link is displayed in the context menu of a highlighted series. If present, the source name of the highlighted series must match this regular expression in order for the link to be displayed.

template.description: The mustache template for this link. The template must expand to a full URL, including scheme, origin, etc.

isLogIntegration.description: Whether this is a "Log Integration" subType of external link

The highlighted series must contain point tags whose keys are present in the keys of this map and whose values match the regular expressions associated with those keys in order for the link to be displayed

The highlighted series must contain point tags whose keys are present in the keys of this map and whose values match the regular expressions associated with those keys in order for the link to be displayed

template.description: The mustache template for this link. The template must expand to a full URL, including scheme, origin, etc.

endTimeInSeconds.description: end time in seconds after 1 Jan 1970 GMT.

hostTagGroupHostNamesGroupAnded.description: If true, a source/host must be in 'relevantHostNames' and have tags matching the specification formed by 'relevantHostTags' and 'relevantHostTagsAnded' in order for this maintenance window to apply. If false, a source/host must either be in 'relevantHostNames' or match 'relevantHostTags' and 'relevantHostTagsAnded'. Default: false

reason.description: The reason for the maintenance window

relevantCustomerTags.description: List of alert tags whose matching alerts will be put into maintenance because of this maintenance window. At least one of relevant_customer_tags, relevant_host_tags, or relevant_host_names is required.

relevantHostNames.description: List of source/host names that will be put into maintenance because of this maintenance window. At least one of relevant_customer_tags, relevant_host_tags, or relevant_host_names is required.

relevantHostTags.description: List of source/host tags whose matching sources/hosts will be put into maintenance because of this maintenance window. At least one of relevant_customer_tags, relevant_host_tags, or relevant_host_names is required.

relevantHostTagsAnded.description: Whether to AND source/host tags listed in relevantHostTags. If true, a source/host must contain all tags in order for the maintenance window to apply. If false, the tags are OR'ed, and a source/host must contain one of the tags. Default: false

startTimeInSeconds.description: start time in seconds after 1 Jan 1970 GMT.

title.description: The title of the maintenance window

endTimeInSeconds.description: end time in seconds after 1 Jan 1970 GMT.

hostTagGroupHostNamesGroupAnded.description: If true, a source/host must be in 'relevantHostNames' and have tags matching the specification formed by 'relevantHostTags' and 'relevantHostTagsAnded' in order for this maintenance window to apply. If false, a source/host must either be in 'relevantHostNames' or match 'relevantHostTags' and 'relevantHostTagsAnded'. Default: false

reason.description: The reason for the maintenance window

relevantCustomerTags.description: List of alert tags whose matching alerts will be put into maintenance because of this maintenance window. At least one of relevant_customer_tags, relevant_host_tags, or relevant_host_names is required.

relevantHostNames.description: List of source/host names that will be put into maintenance because of this maintenance window. At least one of relevant_customer_tags, relevant_host_tags, or relevant_host_names is required.

relevantHostTags.description: List of source/host tags whose matching sources/hosts will be put into maintenance because of this maintenance window. At least one of relevant_customer_tags, relevant_host_tags, or relevant_host_names is required.

relevantHostTagsAnded.description: Whether to AND source/host tags listed in relevantHostTags. If true, a source/host must contain all tags in order for the maintenance window to apply. If false, the tags are OR'ed, and a source/host must contain one of the tags. Default: false

startTimeInSeconds.description: start time in seconds after 1 Jan 1970 GMT.

title.description: The title of the maintenance window

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering MaintenanceWindow resources.

endTimeInSeconds.description: end time in seconds after 1 Jan 1970 GMT.

hostTagGroupHostNamesGroupAnded.description: If true, a source/host must be in 'relevantHostNames' and have tags matching the specification formed by 'relevantHostTags' and 'relevantHostTagsAnded' in order for this maintenance window to apply. If false, a source/host must either be in 'relevantHostNames' or match 'relevantHostTags' and 'relevantHostTagsAnded'. Default: false

reason.description: The reason for the maintenance window

relevantCustomerTags.description: List of alert tags whose matching alerts will be put into maintenance because of this maintenance window. At least one of relevant_customer_tags, relevant_host_tags, or relevant_host_names is required.

relevantHostNames.description: List of source/host names that will be put into maintenance because of this maintenance window. At least one of relevant_customer_tags, relevant_host_tags, or relevant_host_names is required.

relevantHostTags.description: List of source/host tags whose matching sources/hosts will be put into maintenance because of this maintenance window. At least one of relevant_customer_tags, relevant_host_tags, or relevant_host_names is required.

relevantHostTagsAnded.description: Whether to AND source/host tags listed in relevantHostTags. If true, a source/host must contain all tags in order for the maintenance window to apply. If false, the tags are OR'ed, and a source/host must contain one of the tags. Default: false
